body_html:
Since we first released it in late 2016, we've been using CMake as a temporary build system to build TensorFlow for Windows binaries, while the necessary support in Bazel was developed. TensorFlow/Bazel/Windows support has improved greatly over that time (thanks mostly to @meteorcloudy's hard work), and we intend to switch over to Bazel builds on Windows soon. At that point, we will have standardized on a single build system, and it will be easier to support user builds on Windows as well as Linux and Mac OS X. The CMake build will likely remain, but transition to community support. (/cc @ewilderj).

Reassigning this to @martinwicke and @gunan for comment on when the switch to Bazel for Windows will be made, and what support will come with it.
